page.title: 08THE M5 MOTORWAY
page.content: The{M5}was built in the late 1960s to relieve the congestion on the main north/south road through the area, the {A38}trunk road.The motorway has{three {lanes}in each direction and there is a large interchange with the{A40}London to South Wales road. On Wednesday 10th July 1985 we did a traffic survey from an over-bridge.The road seemed quite busy with 1 or 2 lanes usually full.During the 2 hours of the survey approximately 1,200 vehicles per hour passed in each direction.About 70% were cars and 30% commercial vehicles.The number of cars increased rapidly at about 17.30 as people went home from work. Cars and lorries mostly travelled at about 90 to 120 km.p.h..Driving was generally good but several cars and lorries were driving very close.Some cars stayed in the outside lane.
